editorial_summary.overview: Low-key rooms & suites in an unpretentious hotel offering a sports bar/cafe, Wi-Fi & parking.

reviews.text: Hard to find. Nice restaurant with good shashlik and fair prices. At afternoon the local seems normally empty. In the evening it's getting more crowded.

The renovation is not new, the furnishings are ok for the money, but it could be improved a little. You have to wait a long time for hot water, you have to wait about 5 minutes to pump, if there is a large double bed in the room there is one single blanket, it is fresh at night without a blanket, it is also not very hot during the day, there is some kind of row in the closet, disposable slippers are paid, breakfast is paid, some light bulbs the room burned down, the cleaning is ok, but the floor mats have already been seen, the bed is clean, the TV with CRT is old school, there is no sound insulation either from the street or from the next room (you can hear the phone on the bedside table in the next room vibrating), in the corridor there are strangled natives blue snake

We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days out of necessity through the Booking website. The reservation went through without any problems, finding a hotel was not difficult, the price matched, a tourist tax was added to the cost (24 UAH per person). The administrator was polite, the room was spacious, comfortable, new equipment - TV, refrigerator, air conditioning, all furniture made of wood, its own bathroom with constant hot water, liquid soap and toilet paper. They gave 3 white towels for two. In a word, excellent conditions for low cost. There was a little dampness in the room, but tolerable. Also, as a bonus, there was parking outside the gate on the territory. But one thing killed us - it’s hard to call them a “cafe”. It's been a long time since I visited such a disgusting food place! Everything is old inside, unpleasant, there is a persistent smell of fried food. The staff in the cafe is simply no good, I would say “crappy”, the fork fell on the floor - no one was in a hurry to change it! The napkins also did not inspire cleanliness, not to mention the tablecloth! The prices are not low - well, ok, it’s the capital... But for that price we expected to get not only a hot, but also a delicious lunch in the cafe at the hotel where we live, which turned out to be just empty expectations! I would like to eat on the spot, but I had to order food for delivery. A huge shame on you for the food and such a disgusting place to eat! The cafe does not deserve even 1*!! Photos of the room were taken upon check-out, but again, I repeat, there are no significant complaints about it

Inexpensive and tasty! The kebab is finger licking good. But.....the waiters are constantly trying to deceive and write down the check at a price that is not on the menu. Last time, the waiter made a mistake and brought a wine plate instead of a beer plate (we didn’t order it) and we didn’t eat it. The waiter wrote this plate on the check. So be careful here.

We lived for 2 months. Not every day, but 2-3-4 days a week. The rooms are dirty, they stink of smoke from the barbecue 24/7, there is no basic soap, they sell shampoo in a bag as a separate service, there is never hot water, and in the restaurant they feed you stinking, expired, smoky meat! Regular clients are not needed. They demand a lot. At the same time, the minimum is 600 UAH for both the number and the receipt. The kitchen is terrible....The service is dirty. The cook is someone's relative. God bless everyone and give them what they deserve! Do not eat, smell and taste before giving to children. Don't check in without checking out the room
